{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3419467,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T16:02:13.130Z","cooked":"

Onshape consistently gets new features and some of them are very helpful to FRC teams. I figure it makes sense to have a thread to discuss these features each release and how teams can use them.

This month the coolest one I saw is the ability to lock subassembly positions or assign them to follow a named position in that subassembly.

You can also easily set a mate to its min or max limit which is a very nice quality of life feature when checking intake or elevator motions, etc.

Video:

Release notes:

onshape.com

What‚Äôs New: Lock/Follow Subassembly, Normal to Face Curve Pattern, Set to...

Just 17 days after the last release, Onshape 1.186 is up and ready, featuring exciting improvements in assemblies, Part Studios, drawings, and more. Check it out.

My favorite is the ability to clear all missing references! It has saved me a bunch of time scrolling down trying to find that one red selection.

Love the ‚ÄúIsolate and Make Transparent Assembly Folder‚Äù feature. There were workarounds before for sure but it‚Äôs a lot more convenient and means that teams should be organizing their assembly docs more

onshape.com

What‚Äôs New: Product Structure View, Preserved Sheet Metal in Derived Parts,...

Discover the latest features and improvements in Onshape's September 2024 update, including enhanced sheet metal tools, under-constrained sketch indicators, new enterprise analytics, and more.

Derived Preserves Active Sheet Metal Models

  • Useful for the teams that do a lot of sheet metal parts

Indication of Under-Constrained Sketches

  • Awesome for making sure students are fully constraining sketches.

AllenGregoryIV:

Indication of Under-Constrained Sketches

  • Awesome for making sure students are fully constraining sketches.

This is an awesome addition! Too many times I‚Äôve been trying to figure out why a students model is acting up just to find out a sketch is underconstrained.

Needed to do this today it worked very well. This is how you convert a STEP import to a sheet metal part that can be unfolded.

onshape.com

Tech Tip: Converting Legacy Sheet Metal in Onshape

Learn how to convert old legacy sheet metal into Sheet Metal parts that you can unfold in Onshape.

Custom keyboard shortcuts!!! It doesn‚Äôt look like you can map featurescripts.

Sheet metal corner break allows for easier adding of fillets/chamfers at sheet metal corners.

onshape.com

What‚Äôs New: Thickness Analysis, Sheet Metal Corner Break, Decals in Render...

Discover Onshape‚Äôs latest updates including Thickness Analysis, enhanced Sheet Metal features, improved curve editing capabilities, and new Render Studio functionalities.

This one has been out for a few months, but coloring sketches often comes in handy.

  • Flatten is potentially very useful. We have done similar things for hoods/ramps, but they were much more work.
  • Pause regeneration is an awesome quality-of-life feature for making large updates
  • Profile Inspector - This is like the Solidworks Repair Sketch tool and can help find gaps and things that stop a sketch from being a closed shape.
onshape.com

What‚Äôs New: Flatten Surfaces, Pause Regeneration, Profile Inspector

Discover Onshape‚Äôs latest updates, including Flatten Surfaces, Pause Regeneration, Profile Inspector, and new Part Studio enhancements.

Onshape also allows you to protect your Main branch so that everyone has view access. So our manufacturers and assemblers can make measurements without possibly messing up the CAD. Meanwhile the CAD team works on development branches and merges them into the Main branch when needed.

Previously, our CAD would be accidentally broken several times during and after the season. Hopefully that kind of cleanup is no longer necessary.
